title: Weird SHAP value on nonsense features
body:
Here is a reproducible example:

```python
import shap
import lightgbm as lgb
import numpy as np
from sklearn.model_selection import StratifiedKFold
from sklearn import datasets

iris_data = datasets.load_iris()
X = iris_data.data
y = iris_data.target
columns = ["SpealLength", "Spealwidth", "PetalLength", "Petalwidth"]

skf = StratifiedKFold(n_splits=5, shuffle=True, random_state=2)
for train_index, test_index in skf.split(X, y):
    X_train, X_test = X[train_index], X[test_index]
    y_train, y_test = y[train_index], y[test_index]
    X_test[:, 3] = -1
    gbm = lgb.LGBMClassifier()
    gbm.fit(X_train, y_train)

    explainer = shap.TreeExplainer(gbm)
    shap_values = explainer.shap_values(X_test)
    shap_values = np.mean(np.abs(np.array(shap_values))[0], 0)
    feature_sv = sorted(zip(columns, shap_values), key=lambda x: x[1], reverse=True)
    print(feature_sv[:10])
```




And the results show:
[('PetalLength', 4.858092780782831), ('Petalwidth', 0.0012865959831269906), ('Spealwidth', 3.8665361772338584e-05), ('SpealLength', 0.0)]
[('Petalwidth', 2.655228940497153), ('PetalLength', 2.421352212484698), ('Spealwidth', 0.5307075601481597), ('SpealLength', 0.0037697507681040774)]
[('PetalLength', 2.173101023727372), ('Petalwidth', 2.057670109460788), ('Spealwidth', 0.7979735129785577), ('SpealLength', 0.024708537502171113)]
[('PetalLength', 2.867789710676412), ('Petalwidth', 1.9952776618118169), ('Spealwidth', 0.4509510975472647), ('SpealLength', 0.0013865223007028945)]
[('Petalwidth', 2.8352003391762564), ('PetalLength', 2.4441519324102843), ('Spealwidth', 0.4346696659994451), ('SpealLength', 0.020631343251965934)]


What happens?? Since Petalwidth has been set to -1 in X_test which is a nonsense value and never appears in training set before, why it still has such a large shap value?
